metrics.trend: New recommendation filed (#49) after 3 consecutive clean cycles. Eva's directive #329 exposed a blind spot shared by all three orchestrators: QC coverage reported as 25/25 (100%) was actually 25/86 (29%). Main orchestrator response was excellent. Audit acknowledges its own failure to verify the denominator across cycles 15-17. Cumulative: 26 filed, 23 accepted, 2 deferred, 0 rejected, 1 open.

last_cycle.summary: Eighteenth audit cycle. Eva returned with directive main#329, flagging insufficient QC validation (25/86 types = 29%) before npm publish. Main orchestrator responded well (cycle 97): halted Phase 4b/4c, created comprehensive QC-REQUEST #331, added Eva comment tracking step 1.1. Filed audit #49 about QC parity metric framing (self-scoped denominators). Acknowledged audit's own blind spot: cycles 15-17 declared 'ready for transition' without verifying QC coverage denominator. System no longer idle — active work on comprehensive QC validation.
